Added more checks
driver ammend
Updated allowlists

payload.description: Library for specialized dense and sparse matrix operations, and deep learning primitives.

commits.message: Using Mx1 tileblocking whenever possible

payload.description: Library for specialized dense and sparse matrix operations, and deep learning primitives.
Library for specialized dense and sparse matrix operations, and deep learning primitives.

commits.message: Adjusted sample size
COrrect kernel name
More CI fixes
Fixed CI
Added unit tests
CI-HOTFIX 1: align users to new buildkite setup
CI-HOTFIX 2: Fake env script to map to system compilers
CI-HOTFIX 3: using system versions of binutils and datamash

CI-HOTFIX 4: Don't use Intel Python (we don't install this anymore with
oneapi)
CI-HOTFIX 5: reverting 55d523557a0c2bfc0824a7c2067bd9fd22a1f2aa
CI-HOTFIX 6: adopting new buildkite agent name
CI-HOTFIX 7: admend b74430587

Finalize Windows support (#822)

* added xmm6-xmm16 state save under window to GEMM kernel

* Added xmm parts of Windows x64 ABI, right now no optimization is preformed to avoid using xmm6-xmm15

* Fixed Warning when compiling in VS2022

* fixed code length tracking

Merging refactors of "main" branch back to "main_stable" (#825)

* Print command-line into LIBXSMM_MATDIFF-log.

* Updated API documentation/comments.

* Fixed minor typo (code comment).

* Updated convert test after #758. With stochastic rounding based on portable RNG, related LP-conversion can always be tested.

* Reformulated libxsmm_stochastic_convert_fp32_bf8 (equivalent) to extract scalar variant, i.e., to separate stochastic implementation from LP-conversion.

* Separated stochastic implementation from LP-conversion.

* Use full RNG-state instead of truncating RNG-state to scalar bit-width.

* Updated environment (GCC 11.4).

* tool_report.py: fixed building list of filenames.

* tool_logrept.sh: keep output in sync and avoid using stdout and stderr in the same script.

* Improved error messages (generator).

* Revised handling signals. Handle SIGSEGV.

* Updated allow-list for A64FX (Bf8-related).

* Append to PATH (rather than prepend) to avoid hiding alternative Python environment when sourced by ENV_PYTHON=1.

* tool_report.py: refined condition for untied plots.

* Realign libxsmm_stochastic_convert_fp32_bf8 to exactly match implementation of main_stable branch. This will be revisited once stochastic rounding implementation is settled.

* tool_report.py: fixed label (legend).

* Avoid potential compilation warning about type-conversion.

* More compatible/defensive compiler flags (Makefile.inc).

* tool_pexec.sh: disabled logfile(s) by default (it is more suitable to enable logging rather than disabling it).

* Avoid trailing white space (libxsmm_print_cmdline).

* Fixed measured up-time after rip-out of timer API.

* Fixed typos in code comments.

* Modernized eltwise to rely on libxsmm_matdiff_epsilon (benefit of LIBXSMM_MATDIFF-tool, etc).

* Modernized equation tests to rely on libxsmm_matdiff_epsilon (benefit of LIBXSMM_MATDIFF-tool, and more robust norm, etc).

* Complemented 4c5547e8d57bc52cf28c1d7a4038808826bcf052.

* Adjusted/tightened bounds (equation_layernorm).

* Eventually amend LIBXSMM_MATDIFF output with error bound since different bounds are populated depending on actual case/formula.

* Tightened error bounds (eltwise).

* Adjusted console output (newline).

* Improved math test (LIBXSMM_UPF).

* Introduced LIBXSMM_FSSPMDM_DENSE_BIAS (FsSpMDM).

* Rely on libxsmm_matdiff_epsilon (TODO: adjust margin).

* Cleanup console output.

* Updated error margin.

* Updated error margins.

* Avoid potential division by zero (calculated speedup). Code cleanup.

* Updated error margins. Code cleanup.

* Improved accuracy of division (libxsmm_timer_duration_rtc). Rely on clock_gettime_nsec_np (OSX).

* Print newline.

* Code cleanup (libxsmm_coprime2).

* Introduced LIBXSMM_MATDIFF_SHUFFLE optionally shuffling input sequence to avoid numerical emphasis because of somewhat ascend/descendant ordered numbers.

* Limit warning about LIBXSMM_TARGET beyond CPUID to NDEBUG (verbose output), and avoid calling CPUID at all if LIBXSMM_TARGET is given. This regime allows easier debugging under ARM since no SIGILL must be handled, etc.

* Fixed code/format conformance (libxsmm_get_ulp_precision).

* Reset error bounds (unary simple), and introduced separate bounds for legacy/baseline ARM64 (TODO: tighten new bounds or fix OP-accuracy/Newton for ASIMD).

* Code cleanup.

* Code cleanup (libxsmm_timer_tick_rtc/libxsmm_timer_duration_rtc).

* Fixed typo.

* Tightened an error bound.

* Code cleanup.

* Separate error bounds.

* Updated error bounds.

* Code cleanup and call libxsmm_rng_set_seed.

* Updated error bound.

* Code cleanup.

* Fixed testing for existing directory in case of empty input (Makefile.inc).

* Avoid non-portable flag under BSD (join).

* Fixed opreduce script generating test-scripts (chmod executable flag).

* Adjusted error bound.

* Updated error bounds.

* Adjusted error message.

* Avoid warning about constant condition.

* Avoid warning about constant condition.

* Adjusted API of libxsmm_shuffle (libxsmm_memory.h).

* Code cleanup.

* Disabled CHECK_REALLOC under Windows.

* More accurate LIBXSMM_PAGE_MINSIZE.

* Conditional error depending on platform (#775).

* Consolidated handling errors in libxsmm_malloc_xattrib (#775).

* More reasonable internal limits (in-place shuffle).

* Avoid repeated error message.

* Attempt to improve targeting AArch64 under Windows.

* Improved portability and platform support.

* Renamed LIBXSMM_CPUID_ARM_MRS to LIBXSMM_ARM_MRS. Attempt to implement LIBXSMM_TIMER_RDTSC on AArch64 (disabled).

* Removed some platform specific flow.

* Enabled LIBXSMM_TIMER_RDTSC on AArch64.

* Fixed warning about unused variable.

* Fixed potential warning.

* Fixed 12bedaa00210fc7427bc19c4e53f556b42027fe0.

* Disable verbosity during PyFR benchmark.

* Report tool: Removed non-portable flags, and adjusted flow to encode image (base64). Added option for debugging script (PyFR).

* Eltwise: support generating test-scripts in an out-of-tree fashion Ensure all temporary files are removed at exit (generate_unary_transform_test_scripts.sh); there cannot be multiple EXIT-traps per script.

* Support generating test-scripts in an out-of-tree fashion (xgemm).

* Use EXIT-trap to remove temporary file (equation tests).

* Complement 7ecd3320401206145ac04c79d01ed5fa115e4dd7.

* tool_pexec.sh: cleanup.

* Revert "Use EXIT-trap to remove temporary file (equation tests)."

This reverts commit accc23ee56a03d35374d6d7889e5b27483cec9cb.

* Adjusted error margin.

* Limit environment setup/restore (tool_test.sh). Introduced option to omit absolute path values (tool_envrestore.sh).

* Complement 31395852f11708e611077c3a385d8cb35172e9f3.

* Minor improvement of driver code (FsSpMDM).

* Fixed a typo (40c3e8a49ce93b7e5371957394050d27e4cd4553).

* Avoid uploading same artifacts multiple times.

* Complemented/fixed e2dc979ffb75ec2e29aa76c91f7f06e0708da622.

* Emit warning only if founded by feature not present.

* Avoid potential compilation warning.

* Makefile.inc: disabled forcing coherent flags between Fortran and C/C++ (if CTARGET was accepted by Fortran compiler). Improved mixed compiler setup under MacOS, i.e., GFortran and Native/Clang/Apple compiler (added library search-path towards libSystem to LDFLAGS).

* Get rid of local path when uploading artifact from an out-of-tree directory.

* MacOS: account for non-Clang/Apple compiler on newer OS/SDK (Makefile.inc).

* PyFR: print validation results in expected order (X vs Gold).

* Avoid RNG-based initialization for reproducible initialization across platforms.

* PyFR: print location of largest error.

* Code cleanup.

* Capture shared library file-pattern for all supported platforms (#783).

* Avoid warning/remark about missing prototype. Made libxsmm_get_gemm_typename use LIBXSMM_API_INLINE requiring no prototype and effectively making the function private/internal (not part of the API).

* Enable DB-backup even if no new entry/input was provided (-i ""). Adjusted condition for retention to allow trimming DB without need to rely on two command-line flags. Limit warning message to invalid filename/directory.

* Adjusted condition for rebuilding plots (untied).

* Revised handling retention to allow pruning the DB. Fixed filtering branch.

* Updated ABI specification.

* Fixed warning about unused variable. Include missing translation units (VS project).

* Adjusted error margin.

* Fixed typos (code comments, etc).

* Removed all occurrences of JUMP_LABEL_TRACKER_MALLOC

* The tracker was free'd at scope's end, which is exactly what the stack based tracker serves.
* If there was a case for malloc not being free in the same scope, it was a resources leak.
* This code caused static analysis (SA) to claim resource leakage, e.g., in case of an error (LIBXSMM_HANDLE_ERROR+return).
* The issue was raised by recently added BCSC code not covering all error paths by freeing memory (pending SA issues).
* Removed all JUMP_LABEL_TRACKER_MALLOC related code and rely on pointing to stack based loop-label tracker.
* Note: some BE-functions still get the tracker as well as the microkernel-config as part of their arguments.
* TODO: let libxsmm_micro_kernel_config embed tracker by-value, not by-pointer?

* Fix an issue with zero rows with FsSpMDM on NEON.

* Avoid relying on temporary index-buffer (libxsmm_shuffle).

* tool_report.py: judge result/deviation against bounds based on current vs last value unless considering the trend (against median of history).

* Fixed #787.

* tool_report.py: check index before access.

* tool_envrestore.sh: evaluate strict settings even in immediate mode.

* Updated/improved documentation of tool_report and tool_pexec.

* Regenerated documentation. Updated/added requirements (Python).

* Workaround incorrect signature (LIBATOMIC=1).

* Fixed order of variable definition (Makefile.inc).

* Updated environment (Clang 16.0.6)

* Simplified transferring the environment.

* tool_envrestore.sh: transfer paths if parent exists on target (even in strict mode), and always prune path-like values to cover existing parent directories.

* Unset IFS.

* tool_test.sh: minor cleanup/simplification.

* tool_envrestore.sh: avoid non-portable flag (diff), and adjusted strict mode.

* tool_test.sh: modernized echoing and piping variables (cleanup).

* tool_envrestore.sh: introduced proper command-line interface and introduced option to translate values of environment variables (search and replace).

* Install tool_envrestore.sh (make install-dev).

* tool_envrestore.sh: fixed appending to existing values. Improved help output (also shown in case of an error).

* Conforming signature to rely on size_t (libxsmm_rng_seq).

* Extended and improved tests (memory primitives).

* Added sample (shuffle). Include sample code in VS project.

* Fixed warning about comparing signed and unsigned integer.

* Avoid (de-)referencing NULL-pointer (libxsmm_matrix_eqns[idx]).

* Revised base environment.

* Use PYTHON environment variable instead of ENV_PYTHONBIN. Do not attempt to install Python packages when source'ing base-environment.

* Install requested Python packages (tool_test.sh).

* tool_envrestore.sh: revised environment transfer.

* tool_envrestore.sh: prepend rather than append to existing environment variables.

* tool_envrestore.sh: fixed pattern.

* Reformatted (black -l79).

* tool_normalize.sh: integrated Black and Shellcheck (optional). Minor modernization (EXIT trap).

* Improved shuffle/2 and sample code.

* Improved libxsmm_shuffle and sample code. Code cleanup.

* Fixed typo.

* Fixed typo.

* Improved test (memory). Adjusted shuffle implementation (minor).

* Improved test (memory). Adjusted shuffle implementation (minor).

* tool_report.py: extended "untied" argument to allow an optional string (not considered yet).

* tool_report.py: handle invalid input more robustly (try/except).

* tool_report.py: optionally flatten multi-value plots completely (one axis per entry)

* Adjusted untied command-line argument to be interpreted as an integer level.
* Wired LOGRPTSEP into revise untied-flag.

* tool_report.py: fixed code conformance/warnings (flake8).

* tool_report.py: revised setup of grouped and flat plots.

* Simplified embedding artifact URL.

* Reinstated removal of JUMP_LABEL_TRACKER_MALLOC after merge.

* tool_envrestore.sh: made strict restore the default, and introduced --unrestricted.

* Slightly modernized performance.sh.

* tool_logrept.sh: revised launching DBSCRT (eval), and syntactically avoid echoing a variable into a command-pipeline.

* tool_logrept.sh: fixed quoting command.

* Avoid name-clash in certain environments.

* tool_report.py: improved console output.

* tool_report.py: purify (down-)loaded logs (remove Escape sequences).

* tool_report.py: adjusted default margin.

* tool_pexec.sh: allow under-subscription (PEXEC_SP<0).

* Updated environment (GCC 10.5.0)

* tool_logrept.sh: fallback to tool_report.py if wrapper is not available.

* Fixed issues pointed out by Shellcheck.

* PyFR: adjusted error handling of script.

* tool_test.sh: support additional/fallback upload path (artifacts).

* tool_logrept.sh: support alternative database location. Cleanup.

* Adjusted command association for scripts running under debug (set -xv).

* tool_logrept.sh: fixed quoting.

* tool_test.sh: implemented ARTIFACT_UPLOAD_DB, and adjusted tool_logrept.sh accordingly.

* Updated upload path (artifacts).

* Upload artifacts according to ARTIFACT_UPLOAD_PATTERN.

* Revert "Updated upload path (artifacts)."

This reverts commit ce30a9d53fe659c83a0b4d5a7a70e13494a576d4.

* Fixed and simplified uploading/downloading artifacts.

* Fixed uploading artifacts. Cleanup.

* tool_test.sh: fixed ARTIFACT_UPLOAD_DB.

* tool_test.sh: rely on artifact_download function.

* Code cleanup.

* Optionally measure entropy of shuffled data.

* Rely on local variables in Bash function (artifact_download). Fixed issue pointed out by Shellcheck.

* Fixed compilation warnings. Adjusted console output.

* Improved sample code (shuffle).

* Improved sample code (shuffle).

* Introduced WARNING message when GNU=1 was requested but CXX, CC, or FC are defined.

* tool_report.py: adjusted margin (deviation).

* Fixed compilation warnings.

* Calculate move-distance (average).

* Fixed a typo.

* Count actual number of swaps during shuffle (permutation). Code cleanup.

* Avoid compilation warning (type conversion; printf).

* Improved tests (libxsmm_coprime/2).

* Code cleanup.

* Updated MkDocs (v1.5.2).

* Updated documentation.

* Adjusted sample code (equation_gather_dot and equation_gather_bcstmul_add) for main branch (libxsmm_intrinsics_x86.h -> utils/libxsmm_intrinsics_x86.h). Added VC project files.

* Adjusted expression.

* Updated environment (GCC 13.2).

* Streamlined and commented code.

* Improved/simplified syntax (minor).

* Enable header-only installation for out-of-tree builds (related to https://github.com/libxsmm/libxsmm-dnn/issues/17#issuecomment-1681763034).

* Removed cumbersome dependency treating libxsmm_hash.c as header/include file.
* Moved libxsmm_matdiff.h into source directory.

* Support removing an existing PREFIX when "make PREFIX=... install" (CLEAN=1).

* Makefile.inc: allow to keep build state (STATEFLT=0). Permit deletion of PREFIX location if CLEAN=1 is given (removed test about HOME-location).

* CI: removed "clxap" and "clxaptrb" (similar to or complements #809).

* Adjusted sample code for portability, use signed integer for OpenMP-loop. Added VS project.

* Updated documentation with section about "Verification". [skip ci]

* See https://blog.readthedocs.com/migrate-configuration-v2/

* Updated Git-attributes.

* Enforce GNU if requested.

* Complemented ae5647b8cef4a2f8524d3805f19bce45bfd8707e.

* slight re-org of incl. such that an user of the LIBXSMM doesn't have to
decide between incl. utils and none utils directory

* admend a7bb26179

* removed comment

* fixed type mismatches in vnni_pack example

* revert some of the changes, this is for easier debugging of new TPPs,
thus the reverted code is under #if 0

* fixed some datatypes in static code printer

---------

Co-authored-by: Hans Pabst <hans.pabst@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Freddie Witherden <freddie@witherden.org>
Merge branch 'main_stable' into feature_i4i8_vnni_gemms
Used CLX instruction sequence for the zero pts conversion
Started adding infra from i4i8 on amx
Got strdbrgemms and gemms working
Added loop and prefetches fr dequant
Added in some refactoring
Added fincs in header file

Added LLM KV Cache / some GNN equation samples  (#802)

* added initial gold implementation for kvcache 1 benchmark

* added verious tpp implementations

* use smaller blocking for GEMM path

* added equation version for mul + reduce

* added also gather + mul + reduce

* added compiler version benchmarking

* added AVX512 intrinsic version

* attempt to fix CI

* attempt to fix CI

* renamed filed & functions

* add second kv cache driver

* added initial tpp implementation

* renamed file

* fixed bug in intrinsic code

* cleaned-up the implementation

* enable CI for new added equations

uint4fp16 and uint8fp16/unit8bf16 GEMM (#801)

* added usigned int4 weight and f16 activation kernel

* renamed variable

* added uint8 * fp16/bf16 kernel
fixed out-of-tree build

Backported frontend/implementation updates. (#807)

* Updated ABI spec (outdated on main_stable).
* Bugfixed src/libxsmm_matrixeqn.c.
* Improved tests (corner cases).

Issue #790: restore error bounds/logic. (#808)

* It can be assumed libxsmm_matdiff_epsilon mostly impacted by normf_rel (old/new error bounds applicable before/after).
* This keeps calculating error based on libxsmm_matdiff_epsilon (rather than normf_rel).
* Any tighter error bounds introduced by #785 are kept (tighter is better).

Backported environment, scripts, build system, samples, and documentation updates (#806)

* Updated environment and requirements.

* Updated/added Visual Studio projects and new sample code.

* Main/stable: backported build system updates (Makefile*).

* Main/stable: backported documentation updates.

* Main/stable: backported script updates.

* Main/stable: backported sample updates.

---------

Co-authored-by: Alexander Heinecke <alexander.heinecke@intel.com>

Standalone VNNI Pack example for benchmarking against TPP-MLIR (#800)

* added initial vnni pack standalone driver

* fixed initial implementation

* added LIBXSMM kernels

Feature add min col idx reduce (#810)

* Added reduced cols idx min TPP

* Added CI tests

* Consolidated inf_acc flags

Remove Support for KNL and KNM (#809)

* removed support for KNL and KNM

* additional fix

* more fixes

* removed unused variable

* more touch ups

* one more fix

* fixed condition pointed out in review

HOTFIX (as we cannot merge #812 at the moment): removing clxap from CI
infrastructure
Fixed mantissa threshold for hf8 overflow convert (#814)

HOTFIX: temporarily reduce number of tested combinations to accomodate
limited CI resource during infrastructure renewal

aligned norms across all tests, fixing #811 by switching back to old (#816)

norm

Fix SPR BF16 AMX GEMM issues and introduce F16F16F32F16/F32 GEMMs with fusion (incl AMX) (#817)

* First set of changes

* Ammend for 4x1 blocking

* Ammend to n blocking when having C vnni in the amx kernel

* Started adding F16 amx kernel

* Added f16 colbias

* Added fixed f16 colbias

* Added fusion in the gemm AMX f16 implementation

* FIxed CI

* Fixed sigmoid bf8/hf8 fused AMX

* Fixed HF8/BF8 spr relu

* Added fallback logic for bvnni and spr

* Ammend to rpevious commit

* Fixed f16 fusion scipts

* Ypdated CI sscripts and allowlists

* gnr f16 amx fixes

* Cleaned up comments

* MOdularized converts

* Fix CI

Added knob to control srf max n gemm blocking (#820)

* Added knob to control srf max n gemm blocking

* Fix CI

* Ammend to PR

Enhance reduce cols idx tpp (#821)

* Unified PF specific code

* Simplified x86 code

* Simplified aarch64 generator

* Added some infra

* Fixed instr selection

* Fixed inf acc init

* infra for aarch64 codegen

* Removed unused var

* Code cleanup.

* Capture shared library file-pattern for all supported platforms (#783).

* Avoid warning/remark about missing prototype. Made libxsmm_get_gemm_typename use LIBXSMM_API_INLINE requiring no prototype and effectively making the function private/internal (not part of the API).

* Enable DB-backup even if no new entry/input was provided (-i ""). Adjusted condition for retention to allow trimming DB without need to rely on two command-line flags. Limit warning message to invalid filename/directory.

* Adjusted condition for rebuilding plots (untied).

* Revised handling retention to allow pruning the DB. Fixed filtering branch.

* Updated ABI specification.

* Fixed warning about unused variable. Include missing translation units (VS project).

* Adjusted error margin.

* Fixed typos (code comments, etc).

* Removed all occurrences of JUMP_LABEL_TRACKER_MALLOC

* The tracker was free'd at scope's end, which is exactly what the stack based tracker serves.
* If there was a case for malloc not being free in the same scope, it was a resources leak.
* This code caused static analysis (SA) to claim resource leakage, e.g., in case of an error (LIBXSMM_HANDLE_ERROR+return).
* The issue was raised by recently added BCSC code not covering all error paths by freeing memory (pending SA issues).
* Removed all JUMP_LABEL_TRACKER_MALLOC related code and rely on pointing to stack based loop-label tracker.
* Note: some BE-functions still get the tracker as well as the microkernel-config as part of their arguments.
* TODO: let libxsmm_micro_kernel_config embed tracker by-value, not by-pointer?

* Fix an issue with zero rows with FsSpMDM on NEON.

* Avoid relying on temporary index-buffer (libxsmm_shuffle).

* tool_report.py: judge result/deviation against bounds based on current vs last value unless considering the trend (against median of history).

* Fixed #787.

* tool_report.py: check index before access.

* tool_envrestore.sh: evaluate strict settings even in immediate mode.

* Updated/improved documentation of tool_report and tool_pexec.

* Regenerated documentation. Updated/added requirements (Python).

* Workaround incorrect signature (LIBATOMIC=1).

* Fixed order of variable definition (Makefile.inc).

* Updated environment (Clang 16.0.6)

* Simplified transferring the environment.

* tool_envrestore.sh: transfer paths if parent exists on target (even in strict mode), and always prune path-like values to cover existing parent directories.

* Unset IFS.

* tool_test.sh: minor cleanup/simplification.

* tool_envrestore.sh: avoid non-portable flag (diff), and adjusted strict mode.

* tool_test.sh: modernized echoing and piping variables (cleanup).

* tool_envrestore.sh: introduced proper command-line interface and introduced option to translate values of environment variables (search and replace).

* Install tool_envrestore.sh (make install-dev).

* tool_envrestore.sh: fixed appending to existing values. Improved help output (also shown in case of an error).

* Conforming signature to rely on size_t (libxsmm_rng_seq).

* Extended and improved tests (memory primitives).

* Added sample (shuffle). Include sample code in VS project.

* Fixed warning about comparing signed and unsigned integer.

* Avoid (de-)referencing NULL-pointer (libxsmm_matrix_eqns[idx]).

* Revised base environment.

* Use PYTHON environment variable instead of ENV_PYTHONBIN. Do not attempt to install Python packages when source'ing base-environment.

* Install requested Python packages (tool_test.sh).

* tool_envrestore.sh: revised environment transfer.

* tool_envrestore.sh: prepend rather than append to existing environment variables.

* tool_envrestore.sh: fixed pattern.

* Reformatted (black -l79).

* tool_normalize.sh: integrated Black and Shellcheck (optional). Minor modernization (EXIT trap).

* Improved shuffle/2 and sample code.

* Improved libxsmm_shuffle and sample code. Code cleanup.

* Fixed typo.

* Fixed typo.

* Improved test (memory). Adjusted shuffle implementation (minor).

* Improved test (memory). Adjusted shuffle implementation (minor).

* tool_report.py: extended "untied" argument to allow an optional string (not considered yet).

* tool_report.py: handle invalid input more robustly (try/except).

* tool_report.py: optionally flatten multi-value plots completely (one axis per entry)

* Adjusted untied command-line argument to be interpreted as an integer level.
* Wired LOGRPTSEP into revise untied-flag.

* tool_report.py: fixed code conformance/warnings (flake8).

* tool_report.py: revised setup of grouped and flat plots.

* Simplified embedding artifact URL.

* Reinstated removal of JUMP_LABEL_TRACKER_MALLOC after merge.

* tool_envrestore.sh: made strict restore the default, and introduced --unrestricted.

* Slightly modernized performance.sh.

* tool_logrept.sh: revised launching DBSCRT (eval), and syntactically avoid echoing a variable into a command-pipeline.

* tool_logrept.sh: fixed quoting command.

* Avoid name-clash in certain environments.

* tool_report.py: improved console output.

* tool_report.py: purify (down-)loaded logs (remove Escape sequences).

* tool_report.py: adjusted default margin.

* tool_pexec.sh: allow under-subscription (PEXEC_SP<0).

* Updated environment (GCC 10.5.0)

* tool_logrept.sh: fallback to tool_report.py if wrapper is not available.

* Fixed issues pointed out by Shellcheck.

* PyFR: adjusted error handling of script.

* tool_test.sh: support additional/fallback upload path (artifacts).

* tool_logrept.sh: support alternative database location. Cleanup.

* Adjusted command association for scripts running under debug (set -xv).

* tool_logrept.sh: fixed quoting.

* tool_test.sh: implemented ARTIFACT_UPLOAD_DB, and adjusted tool_logrept.sh accordingly.

* Updated upload path (artifacts).

* Upload artifacts according to ARTIFACT_UPLOAD_PATTERN.

* Revert "Updated upload path (artifacts)."

This reverts commit ce30a9d53fe659c83a0b4d5a7a70e13494a576d4.

* Fixed and simplified uploading/downloading artifacts.

* Fixed uploading artifacts. Cleanup.

* tool_test.sh: fixed ARTIFACT_UPLOAD_DB.

* tool_test.sh: rely on artifact_download function.

* Code cleanup.

* Optionally measure entropy of shuffled data.

* Rely on local variables in Bash function (artifact_download). Fixed issue pointed out by Shellcheck.

* Fixed compilation warnings. Adjusted console output.

* Improved sample code (shuffle).

* Improved sample code (shuffle).

* Introduced WARNING message when GNU=1 was requested but CXX, CC, or FC are defined.

* tool_report.py: adjusted margin (deviation).

* Fixed compilation warnings.

* Calculate move-distance (average).

* Fixed a typo.

* Count actual number of swaps during shuffle (permutation). Code cleanup.

* Avoid compilation warning (type conversion; printf).

* Improved tests (libxsmm_coprime/2).

* Code cleanup.

* Updated MkDocs (v1.5.2).

* Updated documentation.

* Adjusted sample code (equation_gather_dot and equation_gather_bcstmul_add) for main branch (libxsmm_intrinsics_x86.h -> utils/libxsmm_intrinsics_x86.h). Added VC project files.

* Adjusted expression.

* Updated environment (GCC 13.2).

* Streamlined and commented code.

* Improved/simplified syntax (minor).

* Enable header-only installation for out-of-tree builds (related to https://github.com/libxsmm/libxsmm-dnn/issues/17#issuecomment-1681763034).

* Removed cumbersome dependency treating libxsmm_hash.c as header/include file.
* Moved libxsmm_matdiff.h into source directory.

* Support removing an existing PREFIX when "make PREFIX=... install" (CLEAN=1).

* Makefile.inc: allow to keep build state (STATEFLT=0). Permit deletion of PREFIX location if CLEAN=1 is given (removed test about HOME-location).

* CI: removed "clxap" and "clxaptrb" (similar to or complements #809).

* Adjusted sample code for portability, use signed integer for OpenMP-loop. Added VS project.

* Updated documentation with section about "Verification". [skip ci]

* See https://blog.readthedocs.com/migrate-configuration-v2/

* Updated Git-attributes.

* Enforce GNU if requested.

* Complemented ae5647b8cef4a2f8524d3805f19bce45bfd8707e.

* slight re-org of incl. such that an user of the LIBXSMM doesn't have to
decide between incl. utils and none utils directory

* admend a7bb26179

* removed comment

* fixed type mismatches in vnni_pack example

* revert some of the changes, this is for easier debugging of new TPPs,
thus the reverted code is under #if 0

* fixed some datatypes in static code printer

---------

Co-authored-by: Hans Pabst <hans.pabst@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Freddie Witherden <freddie@witherden.org>

pull_request.title: Merging refactors of "main" branch back to "main_stable"
pull_request.body: The purpose of this PR is to rework "main" such that it's mergable to "main_stable" with minimal structural changes.

repo.name: libxsmm
repo.description: Library for specialized dense and sparse matrix operations, and deep learning primitives.
